Policy & Procedure 4220: Complaints Concerning Staff or Programs

p.u: Okanogan School District COVID-19 Closure Grading Policy

div.p: Grade carry forward: The student’s 3rd quarter grade will carry forward to the final grading period. For example, if a student had a “B” grade for 3rd quarter, the 4th quarter grade will also be a “B.” Students will continue to be introduced to new learning around essential skills and knowledge for the remainder of the year in order to maintain their “carry forward” grade. Students must actively participate in activities and assignments as given by teachers in order to receive a grade carry forward. Students who do not actively participate will be evaluated for an incomplete and offered opportunities to re-engage to complete coursework at a later date.

Grade improvement: The student may choose to complete work to improve their final grade. Students choosing to complete work to improve their grade should contact their teacher(s). Teachers will determine work to assign and, upon completion, assess whether the student completed the work at a satisfactory level to improve the final grade. Teachers are not required to assign individual letter grades for each individual assignment but provide feedback for grade improvement purposes.
Virginia Grainger Elementary Grades K-3: 4, 3, 2, Incomplete
Virginia Grainger Elementary Grades 4-5: A, B, C, D, Incomplete
Okanogan Middle School: A, B, C, D, Incomplete
Okanogan High School: A, B, C, D, Incomplete

p.u: Distrito Escolar de Okanogan COVID-19 Poliza de Calificacion de Cierre

hr.p: Llevar la calificación: El tercer trimestre del estudiante se trasladará al período de calificación final. Por ejemplo, si un estudiante tenía una calificación "B" para el tercer trimestre, el cuarto grado también será una "B". Los estudiantes continuarán siendo introducidos a nuevos aprendizajes en torno a habilidades y conocimientos esenciales para el resto del año con el fin de mantener su grado de "llevar adelante". Los estudiantes deben participar activamente en las actividades y tareas dadas por los maestros para recibir una calificación. Los estudiantes que no participen activamente serán evaluados para un incompleto y se les ofrecerá la oportunidad de volver a participar para completar el trabajo del curso en una fecha despues.

Mejorar la Calificacion: El estudiante puede escojer completer el trabajo para mejorar su grado final. Estudiantes que escojan completar el trabajo para mejorar su calificacion deberan contactar a sus maestros. Los maestros determinaran el trabajo asignado y una vez completado, evaluaran si el estudiante completo el trabajo a un nivel satisfactorio para mejorar el grado final. Los maestros no están obligados a asignar calificaciones de letras individuales para cada tarea individual, sino que brindan comentarios para mejorar la calificación.
Virginia Grainger Elementary Grados K-3: 4, 3, 2, Incompleto
Virginia Grainger Elementary Grados 4-5: A, B, C, D, Incompleto
Okanogan Middle School: A, B, C, D, Incompleto
Okanogan High School: A, B, C, D, Incompleto
Dear Bulldog families,

With the closure of schools for the remainder of the year I’m sure you all have many questions regarding your student’s education. Okanogan School District is prepared to move to a continuous learning model beginning Monday, April 13th. It is important to understand what continuous learning means for Okanogan, as it means something different in all 295 school districts across the state.

Continuous learning, in Okanogan, no longer means students will be taught the way they were during a typical school day, in a school facility. Nor does it mean learning can only occur through online means. Instead, Okanogan will provide instruction using printed learning materials, phone contacts, email, technology-based instruction, or a combination of these to meet student needs. Instruction and student assignments will not occur in the same way or at the same pace as it does when school is in session.

Prior to Spring Break teachers K-12 prepared long range plans for learning through April 24th (the original last day of shutdown). Please expect to hear from your teachers, or other school staff, via phone or email. Also, please be proactive—check your school email, visit www.oksd.wednet.edu and seek out your teacher’s webpages; if you haven’t heard from a teacher and have questions—reach out. We are in this together and while we are accustomed to coming to school each day to learn in a traditional fashion, we need grace and flexibility during this time. Students, their families, their safety, well-being, and learning remain top priority, but it is going to look different.

Beyond April 24th the learning will continue. Okanogan’s continuous learning model will take us through the school year which ends Friday, June 19th. Please stay connected whether through the district’s website, social media, or by phone as updates will continue throughout the school closure.

Thank you for your patience during this unprecedented time. There is a light at the end of the tunnel, and we continue to look forward to seeing all of your smiling faces again wandering the halls of Okanogan.
Take care and stay healthy,
Ashley Goetz
Queridas familias Bulldog,

Con el cierre de escuelas para el resto del año estoy segura de que todos ustedes tienen muchas preguntas con respecto a la educación de su estudiante. El personal del Distrito Escolar de Okanogan se está preparado para pasar a un modelo de aprendizaje continuo a partir del lunes 13 de abril. Es importante entender lo que significa el aprendizaje continuo para Okanogan, ya que significa algo diferente en los 295 distritos escolares de todo el estado.

El aprendizaje continuo en Okanogan ya no significa que a los estudiantes se les enseñará como estaban durante un día escolar típico o en una instalación escolar. Tampoco significa que el aprendizaje sólo puede ocurrir a través de medios en línea. En su lugar, Okanogan proporcionará instrucción utilizando materiales de aprendizaje impresos, contactos telefónicos, correo electrónico, instrucción basada en tecnología o una combinación de estos para satisfacer las necesidades de los estudiantes. La instrucción y las tareas de los estudiantes no se llevarán a cabo de la misma manera o al mismo ritmo que cuando la escuela está en sesión.

Antes del descanso de la primavera, los maestros K-12 prepararon planes de largo alcance para aprender hasta el 24 de abril (el último día original de cierre). Por favor, espere saber de sus maestros, u otro personal de la escuela, por teléfono o correo electrónico. Además, sea proactivo: revise el correo electrónico de su escuela, visite www.oksd.wednet.edu y busque las páginas web de su maestro, si no ha tenido noticias de un maestro y tiene preguntas, comuníquese. Estamos en esto juntos y aunque estamos acostumbrados a venir a la escuela cada día para aprender de una manera tradicional, necesitamos gracia y flexibilidad durante este tiempo. Los estudiantes, sus familias, su seguridad, bienestar y aprendizaje siguen siendo la máxima prioridad, pero se verá diferente.

Más allá del 24 de abril el aprendizaje continuará. El modelo de aprendizaje continuo de Okanogan nos llevará a través del año escolar que termina el viernes 19 de junio. Por favor, manténgase conectado ya sea a través del sitio web del distrito, las redes sociales o por teléfono, ya que las actualizaciones continuarán durante el cierre de la escuela.
Gracias por su paciencia durante este tiempo sin precedentes. Hay una luz al final del túnel, y seguimos deseando ver todas sus caras sonrientes de nuevo por los pasillos de Okanogan.
Tenga cuidado y manténgase saludable,
Ashley Goetz
We’re working on more access for students to meals.

ul.li: Anyone 1-18 years of age may receive a meal
Thee is no cost for meals

em.strong: If you cannot access a pickup point please call the district office at 422-3629.

span.p: Las Ubicaciones de Recoger el Servicio de comida están Cambiando!!
Estamos trabajando para que los estudiantes tengan más acceso a las comidas!

Comenzando el lunes, 23 de marzo hasta el viernes 24 de abril
 Cualquier persona de 1 a 18 años de edad puede recibir una comida
 No hay costo para las comidas
 Las comidas se servirán de lunes a viernes

hr.p: We understand the recent extended school closure will create hardship for our families. Schools are the centerpiece of our families lives. Children count on the reliable routine a school day provides, and parents/guardians count on the assurance their children are being cared for, educated and nourished while they are able to tend to their own professional or personal responsibilities.
Contemplating weeks without that routine may seem overwhelming. Please know we are doing our very best to make decisions that will help care for all of us through this trying time.
Over the next few days, we will communicate our plan to support families in the following ways:

Meal service: It is imperative the district continue with meal service. Families can count on meals being served at both Virginia Grainger and the Middle School/High School campuses beginning Tuesday, March 17th. Meals will likely be grab-n-go style with no need to plan for eating at school. More details to come Monday, March 16th.

Learning Support: Learning opportunities will be planned to help students practice their skills and learn independently during the closure. These supports will not be a substitute for classroom instruction and will not be graded.
High School Seniors: Support will be provided to ensure students are able to complete graduation requirements.
We will continue to send updates with information and resources via email, text messages, the school district website, and social media channels.
We are grateful for your patience and understanding as we continue to work through this difficult situation. Together, we will get through this because we are Bulldog Family. Go Dawgs!

div.span: The Okanogan School District does not discriminate in any programs or activities on the basis of sex, race, creed, religion, color, national origin, age, veteran or military status, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, disability, or the use of a trained dog guide or service animal and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following employees have been designated to handle questions and complaints of alleged discrimination:

div.span: Staff contact information is not for solicitations.

div.p: Attention 8th-11th graders! It's time to start thinking about who our leaders will be next year! If you are interested in an ASB office (Class President for 9th-12th grades, ASB President, Vice President, Secretary, Treasurer, or Sergeant at Arms) please email Mrs. Brown at tbrown@oksd.wednet.edu. Mrs. Brown will also be teaching our Leadership class next year! If you'd like to sign up for that elective, please send her an email and she will reserve a spot for you in the class.

a.title: Go to comments for High School ASB

div.p: Hey kids! Do you have a book at home that you've checked out from the Middle School/High School library? If you're done reading it, you can return it to the bright yellow box that will be at each lunch pick-up site every Monday-Friday. Feel free to drop books that belong in the VG library as well. We'll make sure they get where they belong.

span.p: Dear Okanogan School District Parent or Guardian,
If you haven’t yet, we would like to encourage you to take a moment to download and install our mobile app for your Android or Apple device.
Android users can find us on Google Play by searching for Okanogan School District
Apple iOS users can find us on iTunes by searching for Okanogan School District
